article.text: Media Against Violence condemned the murder of Sheikh Ahmad Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard and accused the Syrian regime of attempting to cause war in Lebanon. “[We] condemn the assassination of Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard and [we] call for holding accountable [those responsible for the incident],” the group said in a statement. It also called for establishing an investigative committee to issues a report by tomorrow morning. The group also accused the “Syrian regime and its followers of attempting to cause war in Lebanon.” “The biggest proof to this is that as soon as it became [calm] in Tripoli, it was ignited in Halba,” the statement added. Army troops shot dead a Abdled Wahed on Sunday when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria, a security official said according to AFP.-NOW Lebanon
